{"step_by_step_thinking": "Type 2 diabetes is a chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose). High blood sugar levels can lead to various health problems. Therefore, lower fasting plasma glucose levels at diagnosis would generally indicate a less severe initial state of the disease, which could potentially lead to improved outcomes with proper management and treatment. However, the outcomes also depend on various other factors such as the individual's overall health, lifestyle, adherence to treatment, etc.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
